title: Easy Apple Cider Recipe
description: This easy apple cider recipe flavored with cinnamon, whole cloves, and allspice is made in a slow cooker to keep it warm for as long as it lasts!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Drinks Recipes Cider Recipes Easy Apple Cider 4.6 (112) 87 Reviews 7 Photos This apple cider recipe is super easy to make. I used to buy the spices already mixed at the grocery store, and they stopped carrying them, so I just made my own. Great for a shower or get-together, and the slow cooker keeps it warm so guests can enjoy it through the night! Serve with a slice of orange, and add spiced rum, if desired. Submitted by JANE MN Updated on September 8, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle apple cider 3 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon whole allspice 1 teaspoon whole cloves ⅓ cup brown sugar Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine apple cider and cinnamon sticks in a slow cooker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place allspice and cloves onto the center of an 8-inch square piece of cheesecloth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gather edges of the cheesecloth together and tie to secure; place in the slow cooker. Stir in brown sugar. Cook on High, covered, until mixture is steaming and sugar has dissolved. Reduce heat to Low and keep warm. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 171 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Apple Cider 01 of 07 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 07 Photo by  Hammy 12/20/2019 Made it for my staff's annual holiday potluck. I added apple slices while it cooked. Then, I added whipped topping, caramel drizzle, and ground cinnamon as a topper. Staff LOVED it!! 03 of 07 Photo by  Rae 12/04/2009 This was very good. Tastes like apple pie. I did not have whole allspice so I just threw in a teaspoon of ground allspice. I would suggest tasting the cider before adding any sugar. Mine was perfect with out it. 04 of 07 Photo by  pomplemousse 07/26/2009 05 of 07 Photo by  Erin 12/27/2008 06 of 07 Photo by  GodivaGirl 11/01/2007 Quick, simple and tasty! I made this for my Halloween party and it smelled so good! Followed recipe as is and it disappeared! 07 of 07 Photo by  GodivaGirl 11/01/2007 Quick, simple and tasty! I made this for my Halloween party and it smelled so good!
